com.samskivert.util
Class TermUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.samskivert.util.TermUtil

public class TermUtil
extends Object

Provides access to the very platform specific concept of the terminal (ie. vt100, xterm, etc.) in which our code is running. Bear in mind that applications will commonly not be running in a terminal and this code should only be used when the operating environment is well known. It is generally useful to make things behave more nicely for the developer while developing.

          VT100 formatting code to enabled bold text.

Method Summary
static Dimension getTerminalSize()
          Attempts to obtain the dimensions of the terminal in which the application is running (the units are columns by lines, for example 80 by 24).
static String makeBold(String text)
          Returns a string that wraps the supplied string in the VT100 esacpe codes necessary to make it bold.
static String makeReverseVideo(String text)
          Returns a string that wraps the supplied string in the VT100 esacpe codes necessary to display it in reverse video.
static String makeUnderlined(String text)
          Returns a string that wraps the supplied string in the VT100 esacpe codes necessary to make it underlined.

getTerminalSize

public static Dimension getTerminalSize()
Attempts to obtain the dimensions of the terminal in which the application is running (the units are columns by lines, for example 80 by 24).

Returns:
the terminal dimensions or null if we were unable to obtain the dimensions.
